Key Match Events: Kawhi Leonard played 19 minutes and scored 12 points in his season debut Saturday night to help the Clippers beat the Atlanta Hawks 131-105.
Pre-Game Insights: Leonard has missed 290 regular-season games over the last eight years, including all of the 2021-22 season with knee trouble after being injured in the 2021 Western Conference semifinals against Utah.
Post-Match Reflections: Tyronn Lue stressed taking it slow as Leonard gets into playing shape.
Lue thought Leonard's first game back went well and that having him on the floor made things easier for everyone else.
Lue stressed that there is still a lot of the regular season left to play.
Lue emphasized the importance of veteran leadership from James Harden, Norm Powell, and Ivica Zubac.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Clippers are 20-15 record and in seventh place in the Western Conference.
Only 2 1/2 games separate the second- to seventh-place teams in the Western Conference.
Others: The Clippers weren't expected to be five games over.500 at this point, especially after Paul George signed with Philadelphia and Leonard missing the first part of the season.
